title: Doubly Linked List
subject: Data Structures
theory: Nodes contain `prev` and `next` pointers. Allows traversing backwards. Deletion is easier (O(1) given node) because you can access the previous node directly.

common_mistakes.correction: When inserting, you must update 4 links: Prev's next, Next's prev, New's next, New's prev.

interview_questions.question: Advantage of DLL over SLL?
interview_questions.answer: Can delete a node in O(1) if you have the pointer to it (since you know prev). SLL requires O(n) to find prev.

real_world_use_cases.description: Forward and Back buttons map perfectly to Next and Prev.

summary: More flexibility at the cost of memory.
